case.name: Insurance News Pty Ltd (ACN 128 480 973) v JEM Nominees Pty Ltd (ACN 005 304 049) trading as Insurance News Australia [2008] FCA 1966 (19 December 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: appellant sells and promotes energy drink overseas using a mark
respondents commence using that mark in australia without licence
whether primary judge's approach to determining whether appellant's energy drink has reputation in australia was correct. held : it was not
matter be remitted to the primary judge
where applicant and respondent internet service providers
whether applicant had established a reputation in the name "connect"
whether use of the word "connect" in the respondent's logo a representation that the respondent is the applicant or that the respondent is affiliated with the applicant
whether manner in which word "connect" used in respondent's logo sufficient to distinguish respondent
whether public likely to perceive respondent's logo as indicative of movement by applicant into new segment of the internet industry
whether evidence of confusion intellectual property
whether respondent's logo so nearly resembles applicant's trade marks so as to be likely to deceive or cause confusion
whether use of the word "connect" in respondent's logo causes persons to wonder if source of the service is the applicant costs
whether submissions made by applicant without substance
whether evidence of intention by applicant to abandon use of the word "connect" in relation to retail services justifies special order for costs
necessity for distinctive or secondary meaning
substantial evidence necessary to establish secondary meaning
mere expression of confusion or belief by individuals insufficient. costs
both parties successful on some issues
name similar to that of company with established business
principles to be applied. * trade practices act 1974 (cth), s, 52 is set out at p. 22, post. ** the relevant provisions of s. 80 are set out at pp. 221-222, post.
